entries.content: Moti greeted me and started a new session. Ready to continue work on Sementix project.

Implemented splash screen feature:
- Created splash-screen.css with full-screen red overlay and fade-out animations
- Updated base.html to include splash div and CSS link token
- Modified main.js to hide splash on UI_EVENTS.STATUS_READY event
- Extended ResourceTypes interfaces to include splashScreen path/URI
- Registered splash screen CSS in ResourceManager paths configuration
- Added URI resolution in CssUriResolver
- Added token injection in TemplateInjector

The splash screen shows immediately on webview load and fades out after ~500ms when UI initialization completes.

Moti caught me making rushed changes:
- I was about to add console.log instead of using the existing Logger system
- I made changes without properly understanding the architecture first
- Need to slow down and think through the proper approach

The real issue: Splash screen stays visible forever because STATUS_READY event listener might not be working.

Need to investigate:
1. Is STATUS_READY actually being fired? (check SystemLifecycle.js)
2. Is the event listener registered at the right time?
3. Should use Logger, not console.log
4. Should understand the event flow before making more changes

Fixed splash screen race condition:

**Problem:** STATUS_READY event was emitted during ui.start() BEFORE the listener was registered, so splash screen never got hidden.

**Solution:** 
1. Reordered main.js to register the STATUS_READY listener BEFORE calling ui.start()
2. Replaced console.log with proper Logger calls (ui.core.logger)
3. Added informative logging at each step for debugging

**Key insight:** ui.start() emits STATUS_READY synchronously, so timing matters. Listener must exist before the event is emitted.

**Files modified:**
- src/ui/app/main.js - Reordered code and added proper logging

Fixed logger access error:
- Changed from `ui.core.logger` to `ui.logger` 
- The logger is stored directly on UIManager instance at line 22 in UIManager.js
- CoreManager doesn't have a logger property

Successfully integrated liquid-morph animation into splash screen:

**Files Modified:**
1. src/ui/templates/css/splash-screen.css - Added complete liquid-morph styling:
   - CSS variables for Sementix color palette
   - Animated background gradients (radial + rotating)
   - Animated grid background (moving pattern)
   - 3 liquid blob animations (liquidMorph, liquidMorph2, liquidMorph3)
   - SVG logo animation (liquidCore - pulsing brightness/scale)
   - Loading text styling with glow effect

2. src/ui/templates/base.html - Added HTML structure:
   - 3 liquid-blob divs
   - Inline SVG with Sementix logo (3x3 grid pattern)
   - Loading text: "Morphing reality..."
   - All wrapped in .loader-wrapper.loader-4 container

**Animation Details:**
- 4-second animation cycles for all blobs
- Each blob has different phase/direction (morphing in different patterns)
- SVG pulses with brightness/contrast changes
- Background gradients rotate slowly (20s cycle)
- Grid moves diagonally (10s cycle)

**Result:** Beautiful liquid-morph splash screen that appears on load and fades out when STATUS_READY fires!
